ai.summary: A demanding 17.8 km hike along the Grand Union Canal (Slough Arm) in the UK. The route follows a long, flat towpath through a mix of rural and urban scenery, with canal-side views, locks, and bridges. Though the profile is generally level, the distance and potential mud make it a hard day out; pace yourself, take breaks, and monitor weather and daylight.
ai.terrain_summary: Primarily canal towpath with a flat profile. Surfaces range from compacted gravel and asphalt in built-up sections to grassy or muddy patches in rural stretches. Watch for wet conditions near the water, locks, and bridges; some segments can be busy with other walkers and cyclists.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for daylight hours and weather; stay clear of the water’s edge, especially near locks; share the path with cyclists and keep to the left where indicated; carry water and snacks; wear sturdy footwear; bring a map or offline route; let someone know your plans; avoid starting late in poor light or icy conditions.
recommended_gear: Breathable layers and a waterproof jacket
Phone with a charged battery and power bank
Lightweight rain cover or pack liner
Headlamp or flashlight if you might finish after dark
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn; milder weather and longer daylight are ideal. Be prepared for mud in winter and shorter daylight hours.

seo.title: Grand Union Canal Slough Arm Walk – 17.8 km UK Canal Towpath Guide
seo.meta_description: Explore a challenging 17.8 km hike along the Grand Union Canal Slough Arm in the UK. Flat towpath, diverse scenery, practical gear, and safety tips for a hard, rewarding day on the waterway.
seo.h1: Grand Union Canal Slough Arm Walk – 17.8 km
